# Government Tender Announcement
### Overview

The Defence Construction Canada (DCC) has issued a tender announcement for the provision of inspection, testing, and minor repair (ITM) services for overhead cranes, vehicle hoists, and dock leveling devices at Canadian Forces Base (CFB) Kingston and the Royal Military College.

### Project Details

The work includes the supply of labor, materials, supervision, and equipment necessary to undertake the ITM services for approximately 111 pieces of equipment in 19 buildings. The estimated cost for this project is in the range of $602,000.00.

### Security Requirements

This project contains security requirements. The selected contractor will be required to hold a valid Designated Organization Screening (DOS) issued by the Canadian Industrial Security Directorate (CSP), Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC).

### Tender Requirements

Tender documents can be ordered from MERX by logging on their website or by calling 1 (800) 964-MERX (6379). Amendments to the tender documents should be obtained from MERX, as amendments obtained from other sources may not be the latest.

### Important Notes

* No site visit is scheduled for this opportunity.
* Bidders who contact anyone other than the DCC Contracting Authority to obtain clarifications during the solicitation period may be disqualified.
* Bidders can obtain contract award results from the DCC website.

### Quantitative Requirements

The project includes the following quantitative requirements:

* Annual Service Fee Lump Sum: $50,000/year x 3 years (PCA)
* Technician Rate: Blended rate (refer to SOW Annex C - 2.3-2.6)
* Material Markup: Refer to Amendment 1 - clause 1.b.iii. & clause 3.0

### Documents and Bidding

Tender documents and bidding information can be accessed on http://www.merx.com. Fees may apply; see https://www.merx.com/public/pricing for more information. 

### Contact

The DCC Contact information is as follows:

* Name: Ridley Nan
* Email: KNContracting@dcc-cdc.gc.ca
* Phone: 613-547-7853

### Notice

The tender closing date is February 6, 2024, at 14:00:00.
